{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Reserve Market Developer",
  "description": "Guinness Nigeria Plc is a major market for Diageo: Guinness Nigeria operates in the unique and fast-growing alcohol industry of over 15mhl beer potential. It is the only company that does Total Beverage Alcohol (TBA) in Nigeria. It&rsquo;s an on-trade-dominated market but with a fast-growing off-trade channel.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Reserve Market Developer

Job Requisition ID: JR1110100
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Job Type: Full time
Level: L4
Reports To: Commercial Director or GM

Job Summary&nbsp;


	Manages the On-trade accounts and ensures our brands especially Reserve are the most dominant in terms of visibility and rate of sale. Ensure Trade terms are executed in the outlet by working in close collaboration with the Reserve Brand Ambassador under the guidance of the Reserve Sales Manager.&nbsp;
	Manage designated Sales area in the On-trade, delivering stretched brand and portfolio targets across Spirits by effective outlet universe coverage. Ensure all brand communications are up-to-date and in great condition.&nbsp;
	Drive Spirit KPIs in On-trade market. Periodical (Quarterly) review outlet universe to ensure; optimum base number of viable and non-viable customers, call frequency per category, outlet sales performance and OAS review&nbsp;
	Ensure learning and application of the Reserve segmentation to drive Prestige Account trajectory to attract new customers while building and maintain strong relationship network with key industry owners and influencers and keep up to date of new trends&nbsp;
	Ensure flawless execution of 12 months activity plans promotions, innovations, own POP visibility, bar-staff training/ persuasion.
	Implement promotions, develop and execute merchandising programmes at Point of sale with optimum use of resources and materials in order to achieve the highest in-store visibility and sales performance for the strategic brands
	Deploy the use of technology (SFA, Diageo One) to deliver Sales fundamentals on every call.
	Deliver consistent weekly business Reports (WBR) on account activities and competitor intelligence.
	Deliver consistently call objectives with strict observance of safety policies.
	Work with the Marketing team to identify, develop, and manage local marketing activities, including locally-based brand opportunities.&nbsp;
	Inspire consumers, customers and trade to advocate your brands.&nbsp;
	Deliver special events in a way which provides positive and sophisticated brand experiences for our consumers and customers.&nbsp;
	Act as the face of the brand and Diageo &ndash; proud of what you do&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Organize and coordinate launch activities and promotions in line with the brand.&nbsp;


Role Responsibilities
Executional Excellence:


	Event co-ordination: co-ordinate experiential events to build Reserve brands&rsquo; equity&nbsp;
	Reserve brand sales driver implementation in a defined outlet base.&nbsp;
	Oversight of execution of all brand, contract and 3rd space activities within the Reserve team&nbsp;
	Manage relationships with the Distributors and critical Customers in the Team and ultimately responsible for market execution within TLAs and Pace-Maker accounts.&nbsp;
	Ensure execution processes are performed efficiently, while managing costs and risks effectively.&nbsp;
	Conduct business performance reviews with distributors in order to track, monitor and adjust efforts and produce desired outcomes in all key business segments.&nbsp;


Execution Planning &amp; Insight:


	Identify persuasion initiative outlet priorities and drive implementation with Reps.&nbsp;
	Share TTL intelligence with Reps to support world-class implementation of initiatives.&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Activity plan development support&nbsp;
	Provide input to assist in the development of BTL strategy.&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Report on competitor activity to Sales Managers, Customer Marketing and Marketing teams&nbsp;


On the ground, brands&rsquo; leadership:


	Identify, communicate, and selectively manage brand events in outlets.&nbsp;
	Development &amp; management of consumer databases through administrative and reporting activity&nbsp;
	Support training of Trade Execution to 3rd party agencies we work with.&nbsp;
	Monitor market activity to develop the most cost-effective strategies in order to drive volume and profitability through increased penetration and promotion.&nbsp;


Experience / skills required


	Graduate Calibre with 4 years of commercial expertise gained across Sales / Consumer Marketing or Sales Management.
	Good commercial understanding, P&amp;L literacy, strong numerical skills, a high level of computer literacy and previous experience of financial/dat
	Good communication skills &ndash; written and verbal.&nbsp;
	Understanding of the total alcoholic drinks market&nbsp;
	Ability to identify emerging trends &amp; insights.&nbsp; Tenacious in translating this knowledge into commercial actions quickly.&nbsp;
	Demonstrate a high level of self-organisation and good time management.&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Ability to plan, implement activities and work cross functionally.&nbsp;
	Ability to develop strong relationships with trade partners, especially through demonstrating credibility vs. being seen as a brand salesperson.&nbsp;
	Ability to understand the motivations of individual trade partners and plan ROS drivers against this.&nbsp;
	Ability to identify emerging trends in the area and communicate that knowledge to key contacts within the team and Head Office.&nbsp;
	The face of the brand in the eyes of the customer, consumer and media.&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Ruthless in ensuring that all QDVPPP objectives are met with the customer base.&nbsp;
	Aware of financial principles and applies them within own role.&nbsp;
	On Premise Leadership Baseline &ndash; able to build professional, credible relationships with on-trade partners and develop profitable programs.&nbsp;
	Full clean driving license.&nbsp;
	Trade experience (either retail or supplier) advantageous&nbsp;
",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-18",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-23",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "name": "Guinness Nigeria Plc"

Reserve Market Developer Job at Guinness Nigeria Plc




        
    

        
        Guinness Nigeria Plc is a major market for Diageo: Guinness Nigeria operates in the unique and fast-growing alcohol industry of over 15mhl beer potential. It is the only company that does Total Beverage Alcohol (TBA) in Nigeria. It’s an on-trade-dominated market but with a fast-growing off-trade channel.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Reserve Market Developer

Job Requisition ID: JR1110100
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Job Type: Full time
Level: L4
Reports To: Commercial Director or GM

Job Summary 
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Manages the On-trade accounts and ensures our brands especially Reserve are the most dominant in terms of visibility and rate of sale. Ensure Trade terms are executed in the outlet by working in close collaboration with the Reserve Brand Ambassador under the guidance of the Reserve Sales Manager. 
	Manage designated Sales area in the On-trade, delivering stretched brand and portfolio targets across Spirits by effective outlet universe coverage. Ensure all brand communications are up-to-date and in great condition. 
	Drive Spirit KPIs in On-trade market. Periodical (Quarterly) review outlet universe to ensure; optimum base number of viable and non-viable customers, call frequency per category, outlet sales performance and OAS review 
	Ensure learning and application of the Reserve segmentation to drive Prestige Account trajectory to attract new customers while building and maintain strong relationship network with key industry owners and influencers and keep up to date of new trends 
	Ensure flawless execution of 12 months activity plans promotions, innovations, own POP visibility, bar-staff training/ persuasion.
	Implement promotions, develop and execute merchandising programmes at Point of sale with optimum use of resources and materials in order to achieve the highest in-store visibility and sales performance for the strategic brands
	Deploy the use of technology (SFA, Diageo One) to deliver Sales fundamentals on every call.
	Deliver consistent weekly business Reports (WBR) on account activities and competitor intelligence.
	Deliver consistently call objectives with strict observance of safety policies.
	Work with the Marketing team to identify, develop, and manage local marketing activities, including locally-based brand opportunities. 
	Inspire consumers, customers and trade to advocate your brands. 
	Deliver special events in a way which provides positive and sophisticated brand experiences for our consumers and customers. 
	Act as the face of the brand and Diageo – proud of what you do  
	Organize and coordinate launch activities and promotions in line with the brand. 


Role Responsibilities
Executional Excellence:


	Event co-ordination: co-ordinate experiential events to build Reserve brands’ equity 
	Reserve brand sales driver implementation in a defined outlet base. 
	Oversight of execution of all brand, contract and 3rd space activities within the Reserve team 
	Manage relationships with the Distributors and critical Customers in the Team and ultimately responsible for market execution within TLAs and Pace-Maker accounts. 
	Ensure execution processes are performed efficiently, while managing costs and risks effectively. 
	Conduct business performance reviews with distributors in order to track, monitor and adjust efforts and produce desired outcomes in all key business segments. 


Execution Planning & Insight:


	Identify persuasion initiative outlet priorities and drive implementation with Reps. 
	Share TTL intelligence with Reps to support world-class implementation of initiatives.  
	Activity plan development support 
	Provide input to assist in the development of BTL strategy.  
	Report on competitor activity to Sales Managers, Customer Marketing and Marketing teams 


On the ground, brands’ leadership:


	Identify, communicate, and selectively manage brand events in outlets. 
	Development & management of consumer databases through administrative and reporting activity 
	Support training of Trade Execution to 3rd party agencies we work with. 
	Monitor market activity to develop the most cost-effective strategies in order to drive volume and profitability through increased penetration and promotion. 


Experience / skills required


	Graduate Calibre with 4 years of commercial expertise gained across Sales / Consumer Marketing or Sales Management.
	Good commercial understanding, P&L literacy, strong numerical skills, a high level of computer literacy and previous experience of financial/dat
	Good communication skills – written and verbal. 
	Understanding of the total alcoholic drinks market 
	Ability to identify emerging trends & insights.  Tenacious in translating this knowledge into commercial actions quickly. 
	Demonstrate a high level of self-organisation and good time management.  
	Ability to plan, implement activities and work cross functionally. 
	Ability to develop strong relationships with trade partners, especially through demonstrating credibility vs. being seen as a brand salesperson. 
	Ability to understand the motivations of individual trade partners and plan ROS drivers against this. 
	Ability to identify emerging trends in the area and communicate that knowledge to key contacts within the team and Head Office. 
	The face of the brand in the eyes of the customer, consumer and media.  
	Ruthless in ensuring that all QDVPPP objectives are met with the customer base. 
	Aware of financial principles and applies them within own role. 
	On Premise Leadership Baseline – able to build professional, credible relationships with on-trade partners and develop profitable programs. 
	Full clean driving license. 
	Trade experience (either retail or supplier) advantageous 
    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Customer Sales Representative Job at R & R Recruiting Services
content:
R & R Recruiting Services is a Recruitment Agency, Training, Consulting & Human Resources Management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Sales Representative

Job Location: Fatolu, Ipaja - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Gender: Female

Job Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Attend to customers via WhatsApp
	Provide accurate product information to customers
	Process customer orders and follow up to ensure fulfillment
	Respond to enquiries and handle basic customer concerns
	Maintain proper records of daily customer interactions
	Assist in promoting products and driving sales
	Ensure timely communication between customers and the operations team
	Maintain a professional and friendly attitude at all times.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an OND / HND / BSc Degree with 2 - 3 years of experience.


Salary
N100,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: r2recruitmentservices@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: For inquiries, send a WhatsApp message to: 09035411252.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventry Officer",
  "description": "Mopheth Nigeria Limited is a reputable organization charged with the goal of meeting the diverse needs of its growing customers from all walks of life. We began as a community Pharmacy in the year 1997, and through the years we have maintained our standard of being a renowned name in the pharmaceutical industry in Nigeria, however, with respect to our vision consumables, cosmetics, and skin care products, safe water production, grocery essentials, and a variety of baked goods. In addition, our 24-hour availability onsite and online in all our branches has equally ensured our clients can rely on us for immediate service at any hour of the day.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventry Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island (VI) / Lekki -&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	We are seeking a meticulous and analytical Inventory Officer to oversee stock management and ensure accurate inventory records.
	The ideal candidate will monitor stock levels, track movement of goods, conduct regular stock counts, and support smooth store and warehouse operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate records of all incoming and outgoing inventory.
	Conduct daily, weekly, and monthly stock counts and reconcile discrepancies.
	Monitor stock levels and alert management on low or overstocked items.
	Ensure all items are properly tagged, labeled, and stored.
	Work closely with procurement, warehouse, and retail teams to track stock movements.
	Prepare inventory reports and update the system regularly.
	Ensure compliance with company SOPs for stock handling and documentation.
	Investigate stock variances and provide timely reports.
	Assist with inventory audits as required.


Requirements


	OND / HND / B.Sc. in any relevant field (Accounting, Business Admin, Supply Chain, etc. is an added advantage).
	1 - 3 years of experience in inventory, storekeeping, or stock management roles.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and inventory management software.
	Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and analytical skills.
	Good communication and record-keeping abilities.
	Must reside in VI or Lekki for easy commute.
	Ability to work with minimal supervision and meet deadlines.


Salary Range
N200,000 - N250,000 Monthly&nbsp;(depending on experience).

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;consultantmprecruitment@gmail.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;&ldquo;Application &ndash; Inventory Officer&quot; as the subject of the email.

Note:&nbsp;For more information call the recruiter on: 08086726334.",

Inventry Officer Job at Mopheth Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Mopheth Nigeria Limited is a reputable organization charged with the goal of meeting the diverse needs of its growing customers from all walks of life. We began as a community Pharmacy in the year 1997, and through the years we have maintained our standard of being a renowned name in the pharmaceutical industry in Nigeria, however, with respect to our vision consumables, cosmetics, and skin care products, safe water production, grocery essentials, and a variety of baked goods. In addition, our 24-hour availability onsite and online in all our branches has equally ensured our clients can rely on us for immediate service at any hour of the day.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventry Officer
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Victoria Island (VI) / Lekki - Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	We are seeking a meticulous and analytical Inventory Officer to oversee stock management and ensure accurate inventory records.
	The ideal candidate will monitor stock levels, track movement of goods, conduct regular stock counts, and support smooth store and warehouse operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate records of all incoming and outgoing inventory.
	Conduct daily, weekly, and monthly stock counts and reconcile discrepancies.
	Monitor stock levels and alert management on low or overstocked items.
	Ensure all items are properly tagged, labeled, and stored.
	Work closely with procurement, warehouse, and retail teams to track stock movements.
	Prepare inventory reports and update the system regularly.
	Ensure compliance with company SOPs for stock handling and documentation.
	Investigate stock variances and provide timely reports.
	Assist with inventory audits as required.


Requirements


	OND / HND / B.Sc. in any relevant field (Accounting, Business Admin, Supply Chain, etc. is an added advantage).
	1 - 3 years of experience in inventory, storekeeping, or stock management roles.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and inventory management software.
	Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and analytical skills.
	Good communication and record-keeping abilities.
	Must reside in VI or Lekki for easy commute.
	Ability to work with minimal supervision and meet deadlines.


Salary Range
N200,000 - N250,000 Monthly (depending on experience).

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: consultantmprecruitment@gmail.com using ““Application – Inventory Officer" as the subject of the email.

Note: For more information call the recruiter on: 08086726334.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Talbabs Consulting is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria

Qualifications


	Candidates should possess an HND / B.Sc Degree in Accounting and must have a Professional certificate
	Must have at least 3 years of experience in Accounting and Finance.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;talbabsconsulting@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Account Officer Job at Talbabs Consulting




        
    

        
        Talbabs Consulting is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer

Job Location: Nigeria

Qualifications


	Candidates should possess an HND / B.Sc Degree in Accounting and must have a Professional certificate
	Must have at least 3 years of experience in Accounting and Finance.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: talbabsconsulting@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
